metadata.Title: CVE-2017-5085 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - low.
metadata.Description:
Inappropriate implementation in Bookmarks in Google Chrome prior to 59 for iOS allowed a remote attacker who convinced the user to perform certain operations to run JavaScript on chrome:// pages via a crafted bookmark.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-5085` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-browser-l10n - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-chromedriver - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: chromium-browser package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '59.0.3071.109-0ubuntu1.1360').
